comment.text:
Seems to work fine. Dragged the map on pskreporter around and no crash occurred.

karma: +1
No issues encountered while running through test cases.
Works for me x86_64. Gnome, Core2 Quad, 4 GB, Radeon HD 3650.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

Dragging around the Google map from http://pskreporter.info/ for a bit, in an X session, eventually causes firefox to crash with a Gdk-ERROR BadAccess

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):

firefox-50.0.2-1.fc25.x86_64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. go to https://www.pskreporter.info/pskmap.html?preset&callsign=ab1kw&timerange=86400&hideunrec=1
2. zoom in a little and drag around the map until firefox crashes
3. watch backtrace

Expected results:

Firefox works, like it used to before.

Additional info:

$ firefox

(firefox:29887): Gdk-ERROR **: The program 'firefox' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadAccess (attempt to access private resource denied)'.
  (Details: serial 7790 error_code 10 request_code 130 (MIT-SHM) minor_code 1)
  (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
   To debug your program, run it with the GDK_SYNCHRONIZE environment
   variable to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
   backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)
Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped)
Firefox 50.1.0 which is in koji now should fix that.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by stransky.

Seems to work fine. Dragged the map on pskreporter around and no crash occurred.

karma: +1
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
No issues encountered while running through test cases.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
- update to the new upstream version (50.1.0)
- fixed X Window crashes (mozbz#1271100)
title: firefox-50.1.0-1.fc24
